fields.headline: Ask a fellow traveller
fields.bodyText: · We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Manhattan (0800 40 50 60, sixcontinentshotels.com/crowneplaza, from $181.30 a night), 1605 Broadway last year. You can watch from inside or step through the lobby on to the pavement for a great view. They also set up the front bar to serve coffee and Danishes through the morning. John Landau Pamela Jones's son wants to get married in Andalucia. · The perfect answer is the former Carthusian monastery in Cazalla de la Sierra (skill.es/cartuja), which is in the Sierra Morena hills, just over an hour's drive from Seville and just over 2 from Malaga. It has comfort without formality, a beautiful location, and is both tranquil and cheap. Paul Crabb · I went to a wedding last year in the Palacete de Cázulas (rentapalacete.com), an old country house, about 45 minutes from Granada. There's a private chapel in the grounds dating back to the 15th century and a Moorish garden. The main house sleeps about 20, and there's a cottage housing an extra four. Stephanie Watkins · Check out eltorcal.com/Posada Torcal/default.htm. It is 50km north of Malaga and so individual it doesn't feel like a hotel. Nick Smith This week's questions · What's the best way to get from Istanbul to Moscow by train? Richard Cogan · What's Christmas like in Cuba? David Bone · When does the mountain train run from Lima to Huancavelica and how much does it cost? Swallow · If you have questions or advice, please write to: Ask a fellow traveller, The Guardian, 119 Farringdon Road, London EC1R 3ER. Or email: ask.a.fellow.traveller@theguardian.com.
